theorem P1_inter_of_P1_and_open
    {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A B : Set X}
    (hP1A : Topology.P1 (A : Set X)) (hOpenB : IsOpen (B : Set X)) :
    Topology.P1 (A ∩ B) := by
  dsimp [Topology.P1] at hP1A ⊢
  intro x hx
  rcases hx with ⟨hxA, hxB⟩
  -- `x` belongs to the closure of `interior A` by `P1` for `A`.
  have hClA : x ∈ closure (interior (A : Set X)) := hP1A hxA
  -- We now prove that `x` belongs to the closure of `interior (A ∩ B)`.
  have : x ∈ closure (interior (A ∩ B : Set X)) := by
    -- Use the neighborhood characterization of the closure.
    refine (mem_closure_iff).2 ?_
    intro U hOpenU hxU
    -- Consider the open neighborhood `U ∩ B` of `x`.
    have hOpenUB : IsOpen (U ∩ B) := hOpenU.inter hOpenB
    have hxUB : x ∈ U ∩ B := And.intro hxU hxB
    -- Since `x ∈ closure (interior A)`, this neighborhood meets `interior A`.
    have hNonempty : ((U ∩ B) ∩ interior (A : Set X)).Nonempty :=
      (mem_closure_iff.1 hClA) hOpenUB hxUB
    rcases hNonempty with ⟨y, ⟨hyU, hyB⟩, hyIntA⟩
    -- Express `interior (A ∩ B)` using openness of `B`.
    have hIntEq :
        interior (A ∩ B : Set X) = interior (A : Set X) ∩ B :=
      interior_inter_of_isOpen_right (A := A) (B := B) hOpenB
    have hyIntAB : y ∈ interior (A ∩ B : Set X) := by
      have : y ∈ interior (A : Set X) ∩ B := And.intro hyIntA hyB
      simpa [hIntEq] using this
    -- The point `y` witnesses non‐emptiness of `U ∩ interior (A ∩ B)`.
    exact ⟨y, And.intro hyU hyIntAB⟩
  exact this

theorem closure_union_closure_right {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X]
    {A B : Set X} :
    closure (A ∪ closure (B : Set X) : Set X) = closure (A ∪ B) := by
  apply Set.Subset.antisymm
  · -- `⊆` direction
    have hSub :
        (A ∪ closure (B : Set X) : Set X) ⊆ closure (A ∪ B) := by
      intro x hx
      cases hx with
      | inl hAx =>
          -- `x ∈ A ⊆ A ∪ B`
          have : x ∈ (A ∪ B : Set X) := Or.inl hAx
          exact (subset_closure this)
      | inr hClB =>
          -- `closure B ⊆ closure (A ∪ B)`
          have hIncl : closure (B : Set X) ⊆ closure (A ∪ B) := by
            apply closure_mono
            intro y hy
            exact Or.inr hy
          exact hIncl hClB
    exact closure_mono hSub
  · -- `⊇` direction
    have hSub : (A ∪ B : Set X) ⊆ A ∪ closure (B : Set X) := by
      intro x hx
      cases hx with
      | inl hAx =>
          exact Or.inl hAx
      | inr hBx =>
          -- `x ∈ B ⊆ closure B`
          exact Or.inr (subset_closure hBx)
    exact closure_mono hSub

theorem all_Ps_iff_P2_of_closed
    {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A : Set X}
    (hA : IsClosed (A : Set X)) :
    (Topology.P1 (A : Set X) ∧ Topology.P2 A ∧ Topology.P3 A) ↔ Topology.P2 A := by
  constructor
  · intro h
    exact h.2.1
  · intro hP2
    have hP1 : Topology.P1 (A : Set X) :=
      Topology.P2_implies_P1_of_closed (A := A) hA hP2
    have hP3 : Topology.P3 (A : Set X) :=
      Topology.P2_implies_P3_of_closed (A := A) hA hP2
    exact And.intro hP1 (And.intro hP2 hP3)
